file_content.text: The allure of perfection draw you to me again?
What marvelous entertainment, and my test subjects actually put up a fight. There will be no doubts about quality after this.
Come, I'm sure to have something to please each of you.
Come, let's make sure you aren't left wanting.
I hope they give you trouble, it'll look good on the report.
Well, my my, what magnificent specimens.
Lovely. What a marvelous specimen.
You're all so ripe with potential. Intoxicating. It's so rare to find quality materials on Nar Shaddaa. Where to begin?
You have an unhealthy interest in us. I suggest you tell me why.
Explain yourself.
Should we be flattered or demeaned?
Was that a compliment?
What's your business? Slaver? Organ-legger?
Start with your motives.
We're the type of people it's better you forget. Understand?
We don't want your attention.
I'm a craftsman, an artist of form and function. I'm simply admiring gems among dross.
Begone, you freak!
No, no, not yet. I have an enticing proposal for a group such as yourselves.
You're no stranger to the blade, so ripe for augmentation. You could be so beautiful.
I prefer to be terrible.
Beauty is nothing.
You misjudge, I don't deal in the cosmetic. I craft grace, and power, and immortality.
Power flows from you like a conduit. What wonders would you conduct with a little special wiring?
Can one really improve upon perfection?
But I'm already so wonderful.
I don't trifle with shifting organics. It's wasteful. I harness the body and make it more than it was.
Why wear splendor on the outside when there is so much room for it on the inside? I could bring you out of that shell.
I'm partial to it. Thanks.
Wardrobe is part of the job.
If that's your desire, who am I to argue? Though, what I offer is not mutually exclusive.
So sleek. Elegant. Venomous. Like the panthers of Corellia. I could hone you to a fine edge under my knife.
I've had my fill of elective surgery.
No more for me, thanks.
Such a tease. You'll torment my sleep tonight, but you can make it up to me.
You're a strange one.
Is it so strange to be passionate about one's work? It's an art not everyone can appreciate.
Uncommon. Unique, even. Something I could turn into art, not another production.
You're not making me anything.
You don't appreciate my talents now, but I could show you.
You're a strange one.
I spend most of my time gazing inside strangers. We are not so close now.
An unusual sales pitch.
Myself. My hands, my thoughts, my time. They all shape my creations.
The Empire sees the beauty of my work. They're prepared to offer me a lucrative contract for my latest reflex booster.
I just have to assure them that the product performs to specifications. You could help me highlight their effectiveness.
How?
I bet there's a catch.
I'm not letting you operate on me.
Keep your scalpel to yourself.
I don't want you to use my implants. Not yet. I want you to be the measure they are tested against.
I've been selling my implants to a rather vicious band of gangsters, at cost. Now I need to show how much they've improved.
Deploy this medical probe before provoking them, and it will record their performance. Simple, yes?
Define "provoking them."
You want me to kill them?
All too easy.
Just walking through their turf is justification for violence in their small minds. Don't hold back, this should be a true test.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
How can you not appreciate this? If I have to settle for something... less. No, I'll wait if I must.
If only I had the time to look you over thoroughly, perhaps later.
